intro: Euphrasia rostkoviana var. montana, commonly known as the Alpine eyebright, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and branched. This species is valued for its medicinal properties and is often used in traditional herbal remedies.
